name: Lost for Words! 10 Trivia Game | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"He's leaving 
On that midnight train to ______ 
And he's goin' back 
To a simpler place and time."
So where was this mystery train's destination?
questions.explanation:
Georgia.

	"Midnight Train To Georgia" was a 1976 hit for Gladys Knight and The Pips. This US #1 hit peaked at #10 in the UK.

questions.text:
"Close your ______ and I'll kiss you
Tomorrow I'll miss you
Remember I'll always be true."
A classic tune from the Beatles, but which word is missing?
questions.explanation:
eyes.

	These lyrics come from the Beatles song "All My Loving", written by John Lennon and Paul McCartney.

questions.text:
"What's love got to do, got to do with it 
What's love but a second hand ______." 
Tina Turner sang the words, but which one comes next?
questions.explanation:
emotion.

	"What's Love Got To Do With It" was a hit a 1984 hit for Tina Turner. This US #1 and UK #3 chart hit, features on the album "Live In Europe".

questions.text:
"Big wheel keep on turning 
Proud ______ keep on burning 
Rollin', rollin', rollin' on the river."
Who is the proud lady named in this song?
questions.explanation:
Mary.

	These lyrics come from the Creedence Clearwater Revival 1969 hit "Proud Mary". This US chart topper peaked at #8 in the UK.

questions.text:
"Oliver's ______ is here to stay 
Oliver's ______ are on their way 
And I would rather be anywhere else 
But here today."
Which word completes this song lyric?
questions.explanation:
army.

	"Oliver's Army" was a 1979 hit for Elvis Costello and the Attractions. The single peaked at #2 in the UK charts.

questions.text:
"Me and Mrs. ______ 
We got a thing going on 
We both know that it's wrong 
But it's much too strong to let it cool down now."
What is the mystery lover's surname?
questions.explanation:
Jones.

	Billy Paul had a hit with these lyrics from "Me And Mrs Jones" in 1973. This Kenny Gamble, Leon Huff and Cary Gilbert composition, was a US chart topper peaking at #12 in the UK.

questions.text:
"There's a party going on right here
A celebration to last throughout the years
So bring your good times, and your ______ too
We gonna celebrate your party with you."
So what have you got to bring to the party?
questions.explanation:
laughter.

	A 1979 US #1 single for "Kool and the Gang", "Celebration" peaked at #7 in the UK.

questions.text:
"You know I can be found 
Sittin' home all alone 
If you can't come around 
At least please telephone 
Don't be cruel to a ______ that's true."
Which word is missing from this Elvis lyric?
questions.explanation:
heart.

	"Don't Be Cruel" was a UK hit for Elvis Presley in 1978. The song was written by Otis Blackwell and Elvis Presley.

questions.text:
"Strumming my pain with his fingers 
Singing my life with his words 
Killing me softly with his ______."
What was the unusual murder weapon used in this tune?
questions.explanation:
song.

	Roberta Flack had a hit with these lyrics from "Killing Me Softly With His Song" in 1973. This US chart topper peaked at #6 in the UK.

questions.text:
"How much is that ______ in the window?
The one with the waggley tail."
And finally, which creature fills the gap in this lyric?
questions.explanation:
doggie.

	This golden oldie was a hit for Patti Page in 1953.  "How Much Is That Doggie In The Window" was a US #1 and #9 in the UK. The song was written by Bob Merrill.
